problem.title: The Problem
problem.subtitle: Inefficient, high-emission factories with no visibility
problem.intro: Today, many factories in Uzbekistan and the wider Central Asian region face three interconnected problems:

problem1.title: High and invisible COâ‚‚ emissions
problem1.description: Most factories rely on electricity, natural gas, and diesel without tracking their real carbon footprint. This makes it difficult to meet future environmental regulations and to work with international partners who require sustainability reporting.

problem2.title: Unplanned machine failures and downtime
problem2.description: Motors, pumps, conveyors and other equipment often fail unexpectedly. This leads to production stops, urgent repair costs, delays in orders, and wasted raw materials.

problem3.title: No real-time insight into energy waste
problem3.description: Energy meters, sensor data and production logs are either not collected or not analyzed. Factory managers make decisions based on intuition instead of data, which leads to avoidable losses in efficiency and profit.

consequences.title: As a result, factories:
consequences.item1: Pay more for energy than they should
consequences.item3: Lose money and time due to preventable downtime

approach.title: How We'll Build It
approach.subtitle: Our technical approach and key technologies

step1.title: Connect factory data sources
step1.description: Start with 1â€“2 key machines (motors, conveyors). Install vibration and temperature sensors (e.g. ESP32 + sensors). Read electricity and gas consumption data (manual import or smart meters).

step2.title: Ingest and store data
step2.description: Data ingestion API built with FastAPI or NestJS. Use PostgreSQL (and possibly TimescaleDB) for structured and time-series data. Store raw sensor data, processed metrics, and event logs.

step3.title: Apply AI for anomaly detection and COâ‚‚ analytics
step3.description: Time-series anomaly detection using statistical models (e.g., moving averages, thresholds) as baseline and machine learning models (e.g., Isolation Forest, LSTM/Autoencoder) as we grow. COâ‚‚ calculation engine combining energy usage with standard emission factors.

step4.title: Build the factory dashboard
step4.description: Frontend using React (or Next.js/Vite). Real-time updates via WebSockets or Server-Sent Events. Clear charts, alerts, and summaries for managers and engineers.

step5.title: Integrate an AI assistant
step5.description: Use a Large Language Model (LLM) with a vector database (e.g. pgvector, ChromaDB) to store documents and embeddings. RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) to answer questions based on factory manuals, FAQs, and historic data.
